TopicTitle: Paper Space Program 1.8 (KSP Rocket Parts papercraft)

Articles.Content:
When it comes to the landing legs you have to get a little creative. There's only 4 actual parts from the pattern that would work as intended. Some stuff had to be cut from the design and the copious amounts of glue to hold everything in place. I just really wanted to have a model of my standard lander.

Hope not to mess so hard with other landing legs

Hope not to mess so hard with other landing legs

The landing gear is just so small at this scale that it's going to be difficult to work with regardless. Unfortunately, the scale you have it set in is pretty much perfect for desktop models, so it's unavoidable.

What I would LOVE to see is a papercraft model of a kerbal. You have a 'flat' one in the small capsule, but a larger sized one (not to scale of the ship) for putting on my desk would be great. Maybe one of Jeb, Bob, and Bill... Or just Jeb, but everyone has a favorite. Amazing work on the rocket parts and such a fun idea! Bringing 'to life' something you created in-game is such a fun project.

Still, I think we all would LOVE to be able to have a paper Kerbal watching over us. Maybe one of each 'kind': engineers, etc.

*edit: new info* I did see the 'magnificent paper kerbal', but it seems a bit much work compared to the rocket parts. I may check out that project, though, in lieu of there not being a 'simpler' paper kerbal project.

Edited July 11, 2014 by yithpistol

Hi! Is there any chance you could throw the files onto dropbox or mega? Mediafire wants me to pay to download more than one file at once, and downloading each individually would take a while. I do want to build a papercraft ship, though!

What I would LOVE to see is a papercraft model of a kerbal. You have a 'flat' one in the small capsule, but a larger sized one (not to scale of the ship) for putting on my desk would be great. Maybe one of Jeb, Bob, and Bill... Or just Jeb, but everyone has a favorite. Amazing work on the rocket parts and such a fun idea! Bringing 'to life' something you created in-game is such a fun project.

Still, I think we all would LOVE to be able to have a paper Kerbal watching over us. Maybe one of each 'kind': engineers, etc.

*edit: new info* I did see the 'magnificent paper kerbal', but it seems a bit much work compared to the rocket parts. I may check out that project, though, in lieu of there not being a 'simpler' paper kerbal project.

Personally I don't think the one he put together looks too difficult as long as it comes with instructions and color coded tabs like you find on papercraft websites. This would require a great deal of work on Arc's end and he's already doing a lot to put as many parts together as he can.

Hi! Is there any chance you could throw the files onto dropbox or mega? Mediafire wants me to pay to download more than one file at once, and downloading each individually would take a while. I do want to build a papercraft ship, though!

Darn, well I'm looking forward to when you can post these things... I bought some nice hard paper to print out some of my favourite early ships :-D

This is really cool. Cudos to you for making this, I had thought about this being a cool idea a year ago when i made some minecraft building blocks and items/characters using sticker print paper and foam board for my son to build with. I may try and implement this using sheet aluminum (like with coke cans) and printing the papercraft modules onto translucent/matte sticker paper to transfer to the metal pieces...this would also be great for making the landing gears and smaller items such as struts.

This is really cool. Cool idea ! Good luck

Darn, I can't find the parts I need. I really hope you finish the set arc5555 this is such an awesome project! :-) Any chance you could complete for all these parts? (reading from the parts lines in my .craft)

fuelTank

fuelTankSmallFlat

GooExperiment

landingLeg1

liquidEngine3

liquidEngine

longAntenna

mk1pod

parachuteSingle

solidBooster

stackDecoupler

I think you might just be missing the solidBooster and the small fuelTank (unless you expect "FL-T Series Fuel Tanks.jpg" to be cut manually depending on how big it should be... which fuel tank size does your image correspond to?)

Can you please put it up on github or dropbox instead? It's really awkward trying to navigate mediafire :-(

Edited July 19, 2014 by fommil
Those are so cool!
What paper thickness do you recommended to build these with?
I've been using card stock...it's thick enough to keep it's shape yet still thin enough to be easy to work with. 65lb paper weight.

Alrighty!! Here some things i am doing with building these models to help with keeping there shape, making them easier to work with and also makes them a bit more sturdy. Get some sort of circle cutter (Mine was 7.00 at Walmart for X-Acto brand cutter) and some foam board (as little as 1.00 a sheet at the Dollar Store). Here are some photos.

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-gX3mex97j8o/U8_1mA-lgZI/AAAAAAAAAw8/jLDPArokmxQ/w1140-h855-no/IMG_4304.JPG

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-h0H0eaO9yEw/U8_1nhp6b5I/AAAAAAAAAxE/s98PoElsTF8/w1140-h855-no/IMG_4305.JPG

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-Ki4jC_QxQvI/U8_1pWR2vZI/AAAAAAAAAxM/4N_pG0eAuoM/w1140-h855-no/IMG_4306.JPG

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-eoTc0BzGZ7I/U8_1szDkp3I/AAAAAAAAAxc/xTNCIawEvI0/w1140-h855-no/IMG_4308.JPG

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-7dNwvmmo9tU/U8_1veluAjI/AAAAAAAAAxs/2gtEIgPOznc/w1140-h855-no/IMG_4310.JPG

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-gX3mex97j8o/U8_1mA-lgZI/AAAAAAAAAw8/jLDPArokmxQ/w1140-h855-no/IMG_4304.JPG

Alrighty!! Here some things i am doing with building these models to help with keeping there shape, making them easier to work with and also makes them a bit more sturdy. Get some sort of circle cutter (Mine was 7.00 at Walmart for X-Acto brand cutter) and some foam board (as little as 1.00 a sheet at the Dollar Store).
